intro: Petrocodon niveolanosus, commonly known as the snow-white rock cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It is native to regions in Central Asia and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
